text: Upon examination, presence of intermittent elevated circulating alanine aminotransferase concentration, clinical signs of persistent multiple mitochondrial dna deletions, history of intermittent decreased activity of mitochondrial complex i were noted. Further imaging and laboratory tests identified gene variant c.1399G>A p.Ala467Thr and c.3626_3629dupGATA. The patient was started on a tailored therapeutic plan.

The individual was admitted with complaints of clinical signs of sudden abnormal cerebral cortex morphology. Laboratory evaluations detected gene variant R853W and G737R. Clinical monitoring is ongoing.

A medical history of acute abnormal cerebral cortex morphology condition, diagnosed with intermittent decreased activity of mitochondrial complex iv was documented. Genetic analysis confirmed gene variant c911T > G (p. L304R) and 3240-3242 duplication (pR1081dup). Supportive care and follow-up were recommended.

The patient presented to the clinic with episodic elevated circulating aspartate aminotransferase concentration observed. Diagnostic workup revealed gene variant A467T and W748S. Treatment was initiated accordingly.
A medical history of clinical signs of chronic increased csf lactate was documented. Genetic analysis confirmed gene variant c.2243G>C. Supportive care and follow-up were recommended.

Subsequent investigations showed gene variant c.2993C>T p.998S>L and c.3550G>C p.1184D>H. Management involved both pharmacological and rehabilitative approaches.
